content.question:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="The figure presents a 3 row table, with 4 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The heading for row 3 is “f prime of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is negative 3. f of x is negative five halves. f prime of x is negative 1. Column 2. x is negative 2. f of x is negative 3. f prime of x is one third. Column 3. x is negative 1. f of x is negative 2. f prime of x is sixth fifths. Column 4. x is 1. f of x is two thirds. f prime of x equals four thirds."><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="0.05ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="2.5ex" height="4.0ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="2.5ex" height="4.0ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

The table above gives values of the differentiable function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its derivative for selected values of <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)      Let <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, the fraction with numerator f of, open parenthesis, x squared, close parenthesis, and denominator e to the x power. "><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find <math alttext="g prime of negative 1."><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

frqParts.text:
NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION.

Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit.

Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point.

Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number.

<math alttext="The figure presents a 3 row table, with 4 columns of data. The heading for row 1 is “x.” The heading for row 2 is “f of x.” The heading for row 3 is “f prime of x.” The data in the table are as follows. Column 1. x is negative 3. f of x is negative five halves. f prime of x is negative 1. Column 2. x is negative 2. f of x is negative 3. f prime of x is one third. Column 3. x is negative 1. f of x is negative 2. f prime of x is sixth fifths. Column 4. x is 1. f of x is two thirds. f prime of x equals four thirds."><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mtable columnlines="solid" columnspacing="0.0em" columnwidth="3em 0.05em 3em 3em 3em 3em" frame="solid" framespacing="0.0em 0ex" rowlines="solid" rowspacing="0.05ex" width="auto"><mtr><mtd><mi>x</mi></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="1.0ex" height="2.5ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="2.5ex" height="4.0ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mtd><mtd><mspace depth="2.5ex" height="4.0ex" width="0.0em"></mspace></mtd><mtd><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mtd><mtd><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd><mtd><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

The table above gives values of the differentiable function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and its derivative for selected values of <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a)      Let <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, the fraction with numerator f of, open parenthesis, x squared, close parenthesis, and denominator e to the x power. "><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find <math alttext="g prime of negative 1."><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(b)      Let <math alttext="h"><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="h of x equals, f of, open parenthesis, f of negative 2 x, close parenthesis."><mstyle><mrow><mi>h</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find <math alttext="h prime of 1."><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c)     Let <math alttext="k"><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="k of x equals, f of x, times, the arc sine of, open parenthesis, x over 2, close parenthesis. "><mstyle><mrow><mi>k</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>⋅</mo><mi>arcsin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Find <math alttext="k prime of negative 1."><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>k</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the classification of a given expression (e.g., Use the chain rule to find the derivative of a composite function).
